item.title: Jessica add a quote by Walter M. Miller Jr.
item.description: "You don’t <i>have</i> a soul, Doctor. You <i>are</i> a soul. You <i>have</i> a body, temporarily." -- Walter M. Miller Jr.

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Allen Saunders
item.description: "Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans." -- Allen Saunders

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well".
From: "More Maxims of Mark" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "You have to write the book that wants to be written. And if the book will be too difficult for grown-ups, then you write it for children." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "Reader, I married him." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Shannon Hale
item.description: "No chance she'd allow any man to see her naked besides the one who'd gotten her pregnant four times. You broke it, you bought it, baby." -- Shannon Hale

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "I don't want to lose the boy with the bread." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "And while I was talking, the idea of actually losing Peeta hit me again and I realized how much I don't want him to die. And it's not about the sponsors. And it's not about what will happen when we get home. And it's not just that I don't want to be alone. It's him. I do not want to lose the boy with the bread." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Suzanne Collins
Jessica add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "You’re not leaving me here alone,” I say. Because if he dies, I’ll never go home, not really. I’ll spend the rest of my life in this arena, trying to think my way out." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Jessica add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description:
"A lover finds his mistress asleep on a mossy bank; he wishes to catch a glimpse of her fair face without waking her. He steals softly over the grass, careful to make no sound; he pauses -- fancying she has stirred: he withdraws: not for worlds would he be seen. All is still: he again advances: he bends above her; a light veil rests on her features: he lifts it, bends lower; now his eyes anticipate the vision of beauty -- warm, and blooming, and lovely, in rest. How hurried was their first glance! But how they fix! How he starts! How he suddenly and vehemently clasps in both arms the form he dared not, a moment since, touch with his finger! How he calls aloud a name, and drops his burden, and gazes on it wildly! He thus grasps and cries, and gazes, because he no longer fears to waken by any sound he can utter -- by any movement he can make. He thought his love slept sweetly: he finds she is stone dead.
I looked with timorous joy towards a stately house: I saw a blackened ruin." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Mercedes Lackey
item.description: "First commandment: there ain't no such thing as "one true way" and the way you find is only good for you, not anybody else, because your interpretation of what you see and feel and understand as the truth is never going to be the same as anyone else's. Second commandment: the only answers worth having are the ones you find for yourself. Third commandment: leave the world better than you found it. Fourth commandment: if it isn't true, going to do some good, or spread a little love around, don't say it, do it, or think it. Fifth commandment: there are only three things worth living for; love in all it's manifestations, freedom, and the chance to keep humanity going a little while longer. They're the same things worth dying for. And if you aren't willing to die for the things worth living for, you might as well turn in your membership in the human race." -- Mercedes Lackey

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "I took a deep breath and listened to the old brag of my heart. I am, I am, I am." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "He never went out without a book under his arm, and he often came back with two." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Carrie Vaughn
Jessica add a quote by Lish McBride
item.description: "There were no windows in my bedroom, so I had to sit up and read my clock to figure out how angry I should be at my visitor. Eight A.M. I hated whoever woke me up. Had they come an hour earlier, I would have also hated their families and any household pets." -- Lish McBride

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "Life is to be enjoyed, not endured" -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "In all of living, have much fun and laughter. Life is to be enjoyed, not just endured." -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "Stop seeking out the storms and enjoy more fully the sunlight." -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "Mediocrity will never do. You are capable of something better." -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "You are good. But it is not enough just to be good. You must be good for something. You must contribute good to the world. The world must be a better place for your presence. And the good that is in you must be spread to others...." -- Gordon B. Hinckley
